content: Explain how space exploration has expanded our understanding of the universe. Include at least three major discoveries or advancements made possible due to space exploration.

Space exploration has been a cornerstone in expanding our understanding of the universe, offering insights that were once beyond our reach. Through various missions and technologies, we've made groundbreaking discoveries and advancements that have reshaped our perception of the cosmos.

One of the most significant advancements is the confirmation of the Big Bang theory. Space telescopes like the Hubble and the Cosmic Background Explorer (COBE) have observed the cosmic microwave background radiation, which is considered the afterglow of the Big Bang. This discovery provides strong evidence for the theory that the universe began as a hot, dense point and has been expanding ever since.

Another major discovery is the existence of exoplanets—planets orbiting stars outside our solar system. The Kepler Space Telescope, for instance, has discovered thousands of exoplanets, some of which are in the habitable zones of their stars, where conditions might be right for liquid water and potentially even life. This has greatly expanded our understanding of planetary systems and the potential for life beyond Earth.

Moreover, space exploration has allowed us to study our own planet from a global perspective. Earth-observing satellites provide critical data on climate change, weather patterns, and environmental changes. This information is invaluable for understanding and addressing global challenges such as deforestation, ocean health, and atmospheric changes.

In summary, space exploration has not only deepened our knowledge of the universe's origins and the possibility of extraterrestrial life but also enhanced our ability to monitor and understand Earth's systems, contributing significantly to both scientific advancement and practical applications.
